Melodic Unity.title: Group Singing Competition
Melodic Unity.overview: Dive into a dynamic musical event where participants choose songs in English, Hindi, or Marathi. With a five-minute limit, showcase innovation, teamwork, and stage presence in this vibrant musical experience.
rules: Upon completion of registration, kindly note that it will be considered as final, no alterations will be accommodated under any circumstances.
The selection of songs is up to the participant.
Innovative compositions are most welcomed.
Songs should be in English, Hindi, or Marathi.
Vocal beats in Raps are allowed, and mixing (Bollywood + Hollywood) of songs can be done.
Remix versions of old songs can be done.
Songs should be registered before the event to the event coordinators.
No repetition of the song is allowed. Song priority will be based on a first come & first serve basis.
Use of any personal instrument should be informed before the event.
Time Limit is 5 minutes- 3 minutes performance + 2 minutes for stage clearing.
Timing begins as soon as the performance starts. Exceeding the limit will lead to the reduction of points.
Participants should be ready with their instruments or songs before their performance and should not take much time to assemble on the stage.
The karaoke should be submitted as and when instructed by the coordinator.
Participants are expected to observe decency and refrain from profanity.
The decision taken by the coordinators & judges will be final and binding.
Judging Criteria:
- Creativity
- Team Dynamics and Showmanship
- Vocal, Pitching, Rhythm, and Diction
- Costume, Overall Impression, Impact & Stage Presence

Kaun banega surpati.title: Department Antakshari
Kaun banega surpati.overview: Department Antakshari challenges teams to showcase their musical prowess through three exciting rounds. From song lyric decrypting to singing challenges, culminating in the ultimate Antakshari face-off. May the most melodious team emerge victorious
rules: Upon completion of registration, kindly note that it will be considered as final, no alterations will be accommodated under any circumstances.

ROUND 1: RAPID FIRE (WARM UP ROUND): No Elimination
  • - Each team will pick up a chit containing an alphabet.
  • A paper will be provided to each team. The team has to write a movie name from the alphabet that was chosen.
  • Write down a list of movies where each movie starts with the last letter of the previously named movie. Try to name as many movies as possible in 2 minutes.
  • Five points will be awarded for each movie name.

ROUND 2: Elimination Round (2 out of 6 Teams)
  • Photos of singers would be displayed and participants have to sing a song (At least the first verse of the song) of that singer.
  • Correct song will be awarded 10 points.

ROUND 3: Ultimate Antakshari (FINAL ROUND)
  • No song can be repeated.
  • At least the first verse of the song must be sung.
  • The decision of the judges shall be final and binding to all the teams.
  • Time is given to think of a song is 20 seconds.
  • Three chances would be provided per team.
  • Each correct song will be awarded 10 points.
  • The team with the maximum score wins.
